author: Staff Reporter
text:
A 30-year-old woman driver of a van carrying nurses of Rajiv Gandhi Government General Hospital was arrested by the police in connection with an accident in which a 70-year-old man was killed in Periamet on Wednesday.

Mohammad Ali (70) of Guruvayoor in Kerala, was run over as he was sitting near a mosque in Periamet. The vehicle sped away after the accident.

During investigations, residents informed the police that they had noticed a vehicle that was carrying nurses.

Further investigation revealed that the van was from the government general hospital. Driver Kayalvizhi had admitted that she was at the wheel when the accident took place, police added.
title: GH van driver held for man’s death
